newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Fidelity Asia-Pacific chairman Leckie to step down.
newsitem.headline: Fidelity Asia-Pacific chairman Leckie to step down.

text.p: Fidelity Investments said on Friday that Stuart Leckie would step down as chairman of Fidelity Asia-Pacific to return to Britain in 1998.

"We recognise that Stuart has spent many years in the Far East and he and his family feel the need to renew ties with their home country," Edward Johnson, chairman of Fidelity International Ltd, said in a statement.
The statement said Leckie would act as a consultant to Fidelity Asia-Pacific to complete a number of projects, and to provide continuity until a successor was appointed.
It said Barry Bateman, president of Fidelity International, would take over Leckie's responsibilities in the meantime, reporting directly to Johnson.

Fidelity International, which trades under the name Fidelity Investments, provides investment products and services outside the United States, and with U.S.-based Fidelity Management is the world's largest independent investment management group.
